qas.question: What is the definition of Space Control according to the US and its allies?

answers.text: operations to ensure freedom of action in space

qas.question: What is one of the areas of operation that space control serves to protect?

answers.text: operations conducted to protect friendly space capabilities from attack

qas.question: What is the operational environment that Space Control depends on?

context: Space Control is defined as "<a0_0>operations to ensure freedom of action in space<a0_0/> for the US and its allies and, when directed, deny an adversary freedom of action in space. This mission area includes: <a1_0>operations conducted to protect friendly space capabilities from attack<a1_0/>, interference, or unintentional hazards (defensive space control); operations to deny an adversary's use of space capabilities (offensive space control); and the requisite current and predictive knowledge of the space environment and the operational environment upon which space operations depend (<a2_0>space situational awareness<a2_0/>)" (JP 1-02).
